body:
There is a [GoArm](https://github.com/golang/go/wiki/GoArm) Wiki page that anyone can edit, but I'm not sure how easily people will discover it.

[Official](https://golang.org/dl/) ARM builds for Go 1.6 would be great. As one example, Raspian (Raspberry Pi) uses Debian Jessie but the Go and GCC versions are dated enough that they can't be used to bootstrap a newer version of Go. Official binaries could make it a lot easier to try Go, especially for people who are just learning programming.
